utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you in?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've had a cough that started like 4 days ago, um and it's just been getting worse, so I I wanted to come in.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, it's good that you've come in. Um, so the cough started four days ago, has it been constant since?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes it has.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how often are you coughing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I um, I'd say a few times an hour now. Uh when it first started, it was a bit more intermittent, but now it's happening um all day long and throughout the night as well, it interrupted my sleep last night.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh OK, um is it a dry cough or are you producing sputum?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's it's mostly dry.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so no sputum, no blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No blood.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um do you find that there are any triggers to your, to this cough, like um, environmental triggers, like the cold weather, um any old carpets at home, or um you know a particular time of the day, or exertion, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, interestingly, nothing like that seems to really make it worse. It's just been um kinda coughing all day.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and um has anything made it better? Have you tried anything for this cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I tried um drinking some uh like tea and some other cough syrups and it didn't didn't help.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um how about, ah, OK. And if you were to describe the quality of this cough, would you say it's it's, it sounds barky, it sounds harsh, um how would you describe it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh harsh.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Harsh, OK. And if you were to rate your symptoms 1 to 10, 10 being the worst, how bad is it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, 6.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Six, OK. And and have you found that your symptoms are getting worse, staying the same, or getting better over the past four days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Getting worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Getting worse, OK. And have you ever experienced anything like this in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, do you feel wheezy at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't heard any any wheezes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how about uh shortness of breath?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I've definitely noticed some difficulty breathing, um yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and uh, when when did, when did your shortness of breath start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Right around the same time as the cough or maybe shortly after, um yeah, shortly after.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Shortly after, OK. Do you find that there are any triggers for shortness of breath, like exertion?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah exertion. Um as well as like the cough itself, I'm finding that I'm coughing so much throughout the day that I'm having a hard time catching up and catching my breath afterwards.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, for sure. Um OK, and any chest pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chest pain.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um How about feeling like your heart's racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any swelling in your legs or arms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you ever feel like you have uh pain in your calves after walking um a few blocks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any fainting spells or dizziness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, um have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any changes in your vision or hearing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Runny nose or stuffy nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not, no, but I've definitely, I feel like I've maybe noticed a change in my smell.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how so?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just uh, I feel like I haven't been able to smell as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um when did you notice that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: The, really, these last like 2 days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and any changes in your taste?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I haven't really I, I thought, well, I wasn't really able to taste my food, but I thought that was because I couldn't, I wasn't smelling, um so I thought that was just going to go away, but the symptoms have gotten worse.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, and have you had a fever or chills in the past few days?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I've had a fever um or I felt hot anyway.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did you take your temperature?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't checked it, but um like I've been feeling pretty sweaty from how hot I've been.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um so we'll take your temperature today and we'll let you know. Um have you noticed any weight loss over the past few weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No weight loss, how about fatigue or muscle aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh maybe these past couple of days, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK um, any changes to your hair, nails, or skin, like rashes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't noticed anything like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um any changes to your bowel habits?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Any abdominal pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any changes to your urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Uh confusion or memory loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and would you say that you are an otherwise healthy person?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, that's why, these symptoms um really surprised me.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, um so you've never been hospitalized or needed surgery in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't needed to, I haven't seen a doctor in a few years.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, are you on any medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh nope, just uh take a multivitamin and uh, and that's about it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um, OK, um any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh yeah, I'm allergic to um cats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Cats, OK. And have you been around any cats recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. How about immunizations? Are you up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah I am.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Um any family history of lung conditions or heart conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um how about marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh sometimes I'll have a joint with friends or something like that on the weekend, but um yeah, so maybe once a week.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Once a week, OK. Um, how about alcohol, do you drink any alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. Um and where do you live right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I live in a house um with my wife and uh 3 kids.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Is anyone else sick at home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh everybody's been well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any reason to believe that you've been around any sick contacts recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um possibly, um I mean, I'm in sales, so meeting with clients all day, um maybe one of them were sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah for sure. Um, any travel recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no travel, all the meetings have been in the city.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK good. So those were all the questions that I had for you today. Did you have any questions of your own or anything that you wanted to discuss today that I missed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no, that, I was just worried about uh Covid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so that's definitely top on the list right now for things that we have to rule you out for. Um so we'll take a swab today, we'll send it off um for those PCR results, you should hear back in 24 to 48 hours. Uh in the meantime, you should isolate for 14 days, and that includes from family members when possible, and public health will get in touch with you if those results are positive and so they can they can do some contact tracing. If it's not Covid, it could be another viral illness that's going around, and I guess the best therapy for that is staying hydrated, um getting good sleep, and eating nutritious foods. Uh but if your symptoms get worse, like you're running a really high fever, um you're having neurological symptoms like you know seizures or fainting spells, um or if you're having difficulty breathing, um you should come back to the ER. So how does that sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it's really informative. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, take care.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
